english: Taiwanese beverage chain Xing Fu Tang

etymology.description: 幸福 + 堂 = “hall/shop of happiness” → auspicious-sounding shop/brand name.
etymology.interpretation: Evokes good fortune and well-being while using 堂, a traditional, respectable suffix for shops, to suggest heritage and quality. Used as a brand name for a Taiwanese beverage chain.

parts.english: hall; main room; shop (in store names); establishment

examples.chinese: 我们去幸福堂买一杯黑糖珍珠鲜奶(我們去幸福堂買一杯黑糖珍珠鮮奶)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qù Xìngfú Táng mǎi yì bēi hēitáng zhēnzhū xiānnǎi.
examples.english: Let's go to Xing Fu Tang to buy a cup of brown sugar boba fresh milk.

examples.chinese: 幸福堂在很多城市都有分店(幸福堂在很多城市都有分店)。
examples.pinyin: Xìngfú Táng zài hěn duō chéngshì dōu yǒu fēndiàn.
examples.english: Xing Fu Tang has branches in many cities.

examples.chinese: 这个名字“幸福堂”听起来很吉利(這個名字「幸福堂」聽起來很吉利)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège míngzì “Xìngfú Táng” tīng qǐlái hěn jílì.
examples.english: The name “Xing Fu Tang” sounds auspicious.
